fields.fieldDescription: The Record ID (RID) for the customer associated with the remittance instruction.
The Record ID (RID) for this remittance instruction.
Indicates whether or not this remittance instruction applies to loan products.
Indicates whether or not this remittance instruction applies to Stand By Letter of Credit (SBLC) and Bankers Acceptances (BA) products.
"Indicates whether or not this remittance instruction applies to remittances ""From the Customer""."
"Indicates whether or not this remittance instruction applies to remittances ""To the Customer""."
Indicates whether or not this remittance instruction applies to principal payments.
Indicates whether or not this remittance instruction applies to interest payments.
Indicates whether or not this remittance instruction applies to fee payments.
The description of the remittance instruction (system-generated but modifiable) that must be unique within the specified Profile/ Location.
The code for the payment method.
Indicates whether or not this is a default payment instruction for the customer location. This field is not maintained and should be deleted from the database.
Timestamp from when this row was created.
Timestamp from when this row was last updated.
User ID that created this row.  This is a foreign key to VLS_USER_PROFILE.UPT_UID_USERID.
User ID that last updated this row.  This is a foreign key to VLS_USER_PROFILE.UPT_UID_USERID.
The currency code for these remittance instructions.
Indicates whether or not the remittance instruction is approved.

"Setting this indicator to true, indicates that all cashflows associated with this remittance instruction should be autommatically flagged as ""Do It"" when created, enabling the cash to flow automatically when the transaction is released."
Internal indicator which Identifies if this remittance instruction is a Simplified Remittance Instruction or a standard Remittance Instruction.
"The number of the demand deposit account (DDA).  (Applies when payment method is ""DDA"")."
"The CHIPS number identifying the bank through which the cash will clear (when the payment method is ""CHIPS"")."
"The ABA number identifying the bank that will settle with the Federal Reserve (when payment method is ""Federal Reserve"")."
"The CHIPS User ID (applicable when payment method is ""CHIPS"" and direction is ""To Customer"")."
The beneficiary account number.
The beneficiary type code.
The code for the division (when the payment method is Interdepartment Transfer).
The user ID of the person who approved this remittance instruction.
"The DDA number through which the cash will clear (when payment method is ""Book Transfer"")."
"The Swift ID. (Applies when payment method is ""Nostro"" and a ""Swift"" advice has been selected)."
"Indicates whether notification sent will be a Swift advice or a Telex advice (when the payment method is ""Nostro"")."
"The Telex number.  (Applies when payment method is ""Nostro"" and a ""Telex"" advice has been selected)."
"The text of the Telex answer back field (applies when payment method is ""Nostro"" and a ""Telex"" has been selected)."
"If the payment method is DDA, the name of the demand deposit account appears here.  If payment method is IDTS (Interdepartment Transfer), the Attention Party appears in its place."
IMT remittance instructions fax text
IMT remittance instructions threshold
applicable to DDA only
applicable to ACH only and is null for any other type of remittance instruction. Y = savings account. N (or null) indicates checking account.
The Branch Identifier
